{
    "name": "Lemaître metric for a spherically symmetric universe",
    "abbrev": "lemaitre",
    "description": "A metric that describes the spacetime of a homogeneous, isotropic universe with a spherical symmetry, proposed by Georges Lemaître in 1933.",
    "defined": true,
    "derived": false,
    "signature": -1,
    "dimensions": 4,

    "charts": [
        {
            "chartName": "LemaîtreChart",
            "xlineElement": "-dt^2 + (1 - (r / R)^2) * dr^2 + r^2 * dθ^2 + r^2 * sin(θ)^2 * dφ^2",
            "validated": false,
        }
    ],
    "desiredProperties": [
        "christoffels",
        "ricci",
        "riemann",
        "einstein",
        "weyl",
        "g00",
        "infiniteRedShift",
        "horizons",
        "singularities",
        "limits"
    ],
    "diagrams": []
}[0m
